definition: world-shaking (idiom)
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
day/sky/heaven
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]

sentences.english: I heard the roar of the gun salute, then the sound earth-shaking.
sentences.chinese: 我聽到了禮炮的轟鳴，那聲音驚天動地。

sentences.english: Evenif you travel in ideal weather, sea journeys take along time.
sentences.chinese: 即使驚天動地，坐船旅行也要佔用很長時間。

sentences.english: Struggle of course is not necessarily earth-shattering, but it must be worthy of the heart.
sentences.chinese: 奮鬥的歷程不一定是驚天動地，但一定是無愧於心。

sentences.english: In childhood, I thought you were very mysterious, said a few words were also earthshaking.
sentences.chinese: 小時候，我以爲你很神奇，說上一句話也驚天動地。

sentences.english: Peng Chu industrious hands with earth-shattering volume history books.
sentences.chinese: 用勤勞的雙手捧出一卷驚天動地的史書。

sentences.english: Always waiting for a chance to create a "world-shattering second".
sentences.chinese: 一直期待制造“驚天動地的一秒”。

sentences.english: An earthshaking genie narcissists, word of all three ErNvQingChang.
sentences.chinese: 一場驚天動地的人妖之戀，道盡了三界的兒女情長。

sentences.english: That chaotic environment produced the occasional literally Earth-shattering collision.
sentences.chinese: 在混亂的環境會不時發生驚天動地的碰撞。

sentences.english: Then with a shocking bang, half of the ice mountain was blasted away.
sentences.chinese: 然後，隨着一聲驚天動地的巨響，半座冰山被炸飛了。

sentences.english: Yes, I believed we could act flowers in the same tree, was a earth-shattering.
sentences.chinese: 沒錯，相信我們能如一樹繁花，開得驚天動地。
那一剎那是驚天動地的。

sentences.english: The symbol of youth, in the moment of shaking heaven and earth solidified into a sad note.
sentences.chinese: 青春的符號，在驚天動地的那一刻凝固成悲音。

definition: dramatic form consisting of historical narration/history as jocular narrative/to stretch history for a joking story/amusing story with strained interpretations of history/to make an unreasonable comparison in jest
ordinary and mediocre (idiom); nothing to write home about
to imagine the wildest thing/to indulge in fantasy
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
extremely tragic (idiom); with unprecedented brutality
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
stubborn/willful/pigheaded/Taiwan pr. [zhi2 ao4]
lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
amazed
odd/bizarre
strong/vigorous/large-scale
time axis/timeline
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
shaking one to the core/extremely disturbing/hair-raising (idiom)
report of success/report of a victory
to keep on saying (idiom); to repeat over and over again
